result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy S Appleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
With Huber, standard release conditions.

Probation may be transferred to the State of Pennsylvania if accepted.
Concurrent with: 14CF1113

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victim Jane G. or her residence.
Provide DNA sample of not previously done

Case 15CM1178 was dismissed and read into: 14CF1113, and 15CF144.
